H0.text: Transform plate boundary is the type of boundary where two plates slide past each other in opposite directions.

H1.text: Plate divergence is the process that occurs when two plates slide past each other in opposite directions.

H2.text: Transformation is the term for when two plates slide past each other in opposite directions.

H3.text: Tectonic movement refers to the process when two plates slide past each other in opposite directions.

A4.text: A transform fault or transform boundary, is a fault along a plate boundary where the motion is predominantly horizontal.

A5.text: Slip along transform faults does not increase the distance between the ridges it separates; the distance remains constant in earthquakes because the ridges are spreading centers.
